title: Joey King looks smart as she rocks a denim dress while enjoying shopping trip with her mom
text:
She recently returned to the US after filming the sequel to her hit Netflix film The Kissing Booth in Cape Town, South Africa.

Joey King enjoyed a shopping trip on Monday with her mother in Los Angeles' Sherman Oaks neighborhood.

The 20-year-old Summer '03 star channeled vintage style with an all-denim outfit.

Bonding time: Joey King, 20, enjoyed a shopping trip on Monday with her mother in Los Angeles' Sherman Oaks neighborhood

Joey stepped out in a dark blue denim dress that buttoned down the front and featured long sleeves while highlighting her fit legs.

The 5ft4in actress avoided distracting from her striking dress with a pair of beige flip-flops.

She added a luxury wristwatch for a touch of flair while draping her brown suede handbag over her arm.

The Zeroville actress had a cute blue bow tied around her brunette pixie cut, and she stood out with some '60s-style white cat-eye sunglasses.

Casual chic: Joey stepped out in a dark blue denim dress that buttoned down the front and featured long sleeves while highlighting her fit legs

Joey and her mom grabbed a bite while shopping at Sherman Oaks' Sweet Cream, a rustic spot serving classy–casual fare and a variety of pastries.

Afterward, the two made stops at some of the nearby shops, including the upscale boutique SOTO.

Earlier this summer, the star of The Act was in South Africa to film The Kissing Booth 2.

The 2018 original received a paltry 17 percent rotten rating on Rotten Tomatoes and was criticized by critics for its retrograde sexism and a bevy of romantic comedy clichés.

Wrapping it up: Joey celebrated the end of filming The Kissing Booth 2 in South Africa in August with a bikini selfie highlighting her svelte figure

Despite the pans, Netflix's Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos praised the film as a 'hugely popular original movie,' while noting its strong viewership figures.

The upcoming Netflix original reunites her with co-star Jacob Elordi, now best known for his major role on HBO's Euphoria.

Though the original film was set in Los Angeles (and partly filmed there), large portions were filmed in South Africa, a move the sequel replicated.

Joey shared a celebratory selfie on August 17 to celebrate the end of shooting in Cape Town.

'A pile of clothes, 5 deflated birthday balloons, a covered tattoo, a wig, and my last day as Elle Evans in South Africa. Thanks for the memories,' she wrote over the photo.

The Lie star photographed herself in a baby blue bikini trim figure and washboard abs.

Honored: Last month, all eyes were on Joey as she competed for the Emmy for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Limited Series for her role in Hulu's The Act; pictured September 22

Last month, all eyes were on Joey as she competed for the Emmy for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Limited Series for her role in Hulu's The Act.

The series was based on the real-life story of Gypsy Rose Blanchard and her mother Dee Dee Blanchard.

Dee Dee was believed to suffer from Munchausen syndrome by proxy, a condition in which the suffer creates the appearance of health problems with another person, possibly in order to gain attention.

She manipulated her daughter Gypsy into displaying the symptoms of muscular dystrophy, while also convincing her that she had leukemia. Dee Dee's deception forced her daughter to have multiple unnecessary surgeries and biopsies.

Celebrating a friend: Joey didn't win her Lead Actress award, but her co-star Patricia Arquette took home the Supporting Actress trophy; pictured September 22

After years of the abuse, Gypsy helped her boyfriend stab her mother to death in bed.

Joey's portrayal of Gypsy earned her widespread critical praise, as did Patricia Arquette's role as Dee Dee.

Though Joey lost out on the Emmy, her co-star walked away with the Supporting Actress award.
description: Joey King looked chic in a blue denim dress while she and her mom went on an upscale shopping trip in Los Angeles' swanky Sherman Oaks neighborhood.
